answer: <p>Normally you cant update a page from a servlet. The client (browser) has to request an update. Either the  client loads a whole new page or it requests an update to a part of an existing page. This technique is called Ajax.</p>
data.title: How should I use servlets and Ajax?
data.content:
<p>Whenever I print something inside the servlet and call it by the webbrowser, it returns a new page containing that text. Is there a way to print the text in the current page using Ajax?</p>
<p><sub>I'm very new to web applications and servlets.</sub></p>
